definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: An apparatus used to transmit radio signals; a transmitter.
sentences.chinese: 他们想法把广播设备改装成无线电发报机。

sentences.english: You crocheted Star Trek communicators for the whole family.
sentences.chinese: 你给全家每人都用钩针编织了一个星球大战发报机。

sentences.english: The sender may use whatever language permitted by the country of destination.
sentences.chinese: 发报人可以用收报国准用的任何语言。

sentences.english: Machine- gun bullets packed up the enemy plane's transmitter.
sentences.chinese: 机枪子弹把敌机的发报机打哑了。

sentences.english: As to the receiver and manipulator, they were very simple.
sentences.chinese: 至于收报机和发报机，制造起来非常简单。

sentences.english: An apparatus used to transmit radio signals;
sentences.chinese: 他们想法把广播设备改装成无线电发报机。

sentences.english: Yes, please . Can you recommend a store where I can buy some gifts for my friends?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能介绍我一家商店，我想买些礼发报给朋友。

sentences.english: The transmitter, the operator said, has already stood by.
sentences.chinese: 发报员说，发报机已做好了发放信号的准备。

sentences.english: The transmitter, the operator said, has already stood by.
sentences.chinese: 发报员说，发报机已做好了发放信号的准备。

definition: to reply to a telegram/to wire back
flag signals (for communicating between ships or army units)/semaphore
